items.sentence: Both of Tom's brothers are older than he is.
I'm going to be thirty years old in October.
Things didn't turn out the way Tom expected.
Do you think you'll be in Boston all summer?
You're not the one who bought this, are you?
Tom likes talking to strangers, but I don't.
You're going to have to spell it out for me.
Tom needs to learn how to control his anger.
Don't think you can escape the consequences.
I wish I could give you everything you want.
Would it be OK if I stayed here for a while?
Please tell Tom that he has to do that soon.
Tom had to interview for that job in French.
All the songs we plan to sing are in French.
Tom needs to continue doing what he's doing.
Tom needs to know what we're planning to do.
Tom did well in every subject except French.
I thought that you knew how to speak French.
I don't see anything wrong with that at all.
You shouldn't use someone else's toothbrush.
By the time I arrived, Tom had already left.
I hope that you didn't forget to invite Tom.
Would you like to see something interesting?
Why did you decide to become an electrician?
Things aren't going like I expected them to.
Tom no longer enjoys watching horror movies.
Tom went to the bookstore to buy some books.
Tom wears a kilt when he plays the bagpipes.
Tom was trying to ignore what was happening.
Tom was surprised when his plan didn't work.
Tom usually stays at a hotel on Park Street.
Tom sure has managed to make a lot of money.
Tom still has a lot of things he has to buy.
Tom starts his job at 2:30 in the afternoon.
Tom started working here in October of 2013.
Tom spent the morning reading the newspaper.
Tom sounds like a pretty interesting person.
Tom sometimes help me with my math homework.
Tom shouldn't have permitted you to do that.
Tom says he thinks he'll be able to do that.
Tom sat in his armchair, reading a magazine.
Tom ran away from home when he was thirteen.
Tom promised me he'd do that, but he didn't.
Tom probably doesn't yet know what happened.
Tom only bakes three loaves of bread a week.
Tom often goes to the library to read books.
Tom lives on an island in the South Pacific.
Tom isn't going to be very happy to do that.
Tom is very busy getting ready for his trip.
Tom is the only one who volunteered to help.
